A WAF specifically protects against DDoS attacks, while traditional firewalls do not.

Static analysis evaluates a program's code without executing it, focusing on source code weaknesses, while dynamic analysis tests the running application for vulnerabilities, offering real-world testing scenarios.
Static analysis is exclusively used for network security, whereas dynamic analysis is used for application security testing only.
Both static and dynamic analysis require the application to be running in a live environment to detect security vulnerabilities.
Static analysis involves manual code reviews by security experts, while dynamic analysis automates these reviews using AI algorithms.
